basic_info.description: I'm Andrew Giang. I have an entensive background in analytics with a BS and Master degrees in computational applied mathematics. I have 2 years of experience working in software development and 10 years of experience teaching math and computer science at a Title 1 high school in East Los Angeles. Currently, I am learning JavaScript, React, Ruby on Rails through a coding program at Epicodus. I am currently seeking full time employment as a software engineer

projects.title: Credit Card Suggestor
projects.description: A web application that will allow you to manage your personal wallet of credit cards. You first need to create an account with an email and password. Once signed in, you can add cards to your personal wallet in two different ways. You can either choose from a list of popular credit cards or add custom cards with their cash back rewards. With your wallet set up, you can use the suggest tool to sort your cards according to a selected category.

projects.title: Student Progress Tracker
projects.description: A web application designed to track student scores on various tests over their time at the school. This implementation was inspired by a school's usage of a Google Spreadsheet for their tracking instead of an in-house website application. The end goal was to replicate and design a website that the school would consider implementing over their current spreadsheet. Our finished application was able to accomplish this goal. Click on the link next to the project name for a demo. You can login using username: admin@example.com and password: password.

projects.title: Minesweeper
projects.description: This project is a web application that run the classic game Minesweeper in three different modes.

projects.title: StickR
projects.description: This application allows users to create an account and upload photos to their account. Normal users would have access to upload, edit, and delete photos. Admin users can view and delete users and their photos from the database.

projects.title: Conway's Game of Life
projects.description: This is my implementation of Conway's Game of Life. This is a solo side project that I worked for fun and for practice with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Currently, I have only 4 preset patterns. I intend to add a few more soon. The application will allow users to dictate their desired number of iterations and iterative speed.

projects.title: Cocktail Cats
projects.description: This project make use of different public APIs to randomly generate some cards featuring cats and mixed drinks. When you hover over each card, the card flips over to show a detail description of the cat's favorite drinks (including recipe and mixing instructions)
